intro: Sericolea brassii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a compact rosette structure. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Sericolea brassii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
